I had an opportunity to meet Vijayant during the summer of 2015 when he joined our team during the summer to help our Project Management and Marketing efforts. It was quite clear after the first few moments that we met that “VJ” was here to get work done, and allot of it. Vijayant was able to come into a rather chaotic environment and settle into our group on the very first day. In a matter of hours, he was able to take on project management responsibilities full-time employees were just unable to grasp. After a few days, it was apparent that we were working with a rather ambitious individual. One of Vijayant’s greatest skills is the ability to ask the right questions. VJ has the rare ability to listen very carefully and then ask questions that help to clarify and codify an action plan for the entire group.Our summer with VJ ended all too soon as he was slated to return to finish up his last semester at school. I highly encourage potential employers to take a good look at VJ for their next hiring endeavor.

Graduate Teaching Assistant at University of Pittsburgh

As co-advisor to the Barrett Association of Transfer Students (BATS), I worked closely with VJ -- co-founder and first president of this student organization affiliated with the Barrett Honors College at Arizona State University. In his role, VJ took on many of the responsibilities associated with developing a nascent student-led group: identifying and codifying goals and procedures, recruiting membership, leading bi-weekly member meetings, facilitating a productive work ethic among fellow officers, and serving as a liaison between the group and college administration. VJ's leadership proved to be a shining light for BATS, which was just recognized as the university's Most Promising Student Organization at the annual Pitchfork Awards.
